title: FBI Dismantles Ubiquiti Router Botnet Controlled by Russian Cyberspies
description:
The US government says it has neutralized a network of hundreds of Ubiquiti Edge OS routers under the control of the Russia's APT28 hackers.

The post FBI Dismantles Ubiquiti Router Botnet Controlled by Russian Cyberspies appeared first on SecurityWeek.

title: Cyberattacks on Hospitals Are Likely to Increase, Putting Lives at Risk, Experts Warn
description:
Hospitals around the country are at risk for attacks like the one that is crippling operations at a children’s hospital, and some say the government is doing too little prevent such breaches.

The post Cyberattacks on Hospitals Are Likely to Increase, Putting Lives at Risk, Experts Warn appeared first on SecurityWeek.

title: Cyberattack Disrupts Production at Varta Battery Factories
description:
Production at five plants of German battery maker Varta has been disrupted by a cyberattack, possibly a ransomware attack.

The post Cyberattack Disrupts Production at Varta Battery Factories appeared first on SecurityWeek.

title: ESET Patches High-Severity Privilege Escalation Vulnerability
description:
ESET has released patches for a high-severity elevation of privilege vulnerability in its Windows security products.

The post ESET Patches High-Severity Privilege Escalation Vulnerability appeared first on SecurityWeek.

title: No Security Scrutiny for Half of Major Code Changes: AppSec Survey
description:
Only 54% of major code changes go through a full security review, a new CrowdStrike State of Application Security report reveals.

The post No Security Scrutiny for Half of Major Code Changes: AppSec Survey appeared first on SecurityWeek.

title: New Wi-Fi Authentication Bypass Flaws Expose Home, Enterprise Networks
description:
A couple of Wi-Fi authentication bypass vulnerabilities found in open source software can expose enterprise and home networks to attacks.

The post New Wi-Fi Authentication Bypass Flaws Expose Home, Enterprise Networks appeared first on SecurityWeek.

title: Microsoft Warns of Exploited Exchange Server Zero-Day
description:
Microsoft says a newly patched Exchange Server vulnerability (CVE-2024-21410) has been exploited in attacks.

The post Microsoft Warns of Exploited Exchange Server Zero-Day appeared first on SecurityWeek.

title: DDoS Hacktivism is Back With a Geopolitical Vengeance
description:
DDoS attacks have evolved from social protests through criminal extortion, hack attack smokescreens and competitor suppression to geopolitical vengeance.

The post DDoS Hacktivism is Back With a Geopolitical Vengeance appeared first on SecurityWeek.

title: Cisco Announces It is Laying Off Thousands of Workers
description:
About 5 percent of Cisco's global workforce will be affected by layoffs, the Silicon Valley-based company said.

The post Cisco Announces It is Laying Off Thousands of Workers appeared first on SecurityWeek.
